user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_str_equal_quoted_bin_n:
```c
bool
MHD_str_equal_quoted_bin_n (const char *quoted,
                            size_t quoted_len,
                            const char *unquoted,
                            size_t unquoted_len)
{
  size_t i;
  size_t j;
  if (unquoted_len < quoted_len / 2)
    return false;

  j = 0;
  for (i = 0; quoted_len > i && unquoted_len > j; ++i, ++j)
  {
    if ('\\' == quoted[i])
    {
      i++; /* Advance to the next character */
      if (quoted_len == i)
        return false; /* No character after escaping backslash */
    }
    if (quoted[i] != unquoted[j])
      return false; /* Different characters */
  }
  if ((quoted_len != i) || (unquoted_len != j))
    return false; /* The strings have different length */

  return true;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_str_equal_quoted_bin_n:

explanation: No code fragment in the provided snippets calls MHD_str_equal_quoted_bin_n (or any other function) either directly or indirectly. The function body contains only local variables, comparisons, increments and returns; there are no function calls, no function-pointer invocations, no macros that expand to calls, and no references to other functions that could produce indirect recursion. The repeated identical definitions in the additional code are duplicates of the same non-calling implementation and do not call each other. Therefore, based on the supplied code fragments, there is no evidence of direct or indirect self-calls to investigate for Rule 17.2. If there are other files or unseen code that reference this function (calls or function-pointer usage), those should be examined, but they are not present in the supplied fragments.
